number of helpful: 1 of 4 people (25%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 24, 2016
Early Access Review
								I've practically given up on this game getting developed any further, but that doesn't stop me from enjoying the existing game.  The story is pretty much nonexistant, but that's ok, because the core of Overgrowth, isn't story, it's fighting.  This game has the best melee combat I've ever played.  The bulk of the game is brawling with rabbits, cats, dogs, and even rats in endless arena matchs.  You can beat them into submission with your bare paws or hack them to death with a variety of weapons.  The subtleties of combat in this game.  If you get knifed in the arm, blood drips down from the gash.  Jumping also keeps fights interesting.  A well timed jump will let you kick and opponent in the head midair, and a poor landing will break your neck and kill you instantly.  While the game doesn't run particularly well, the controls are fairly simple and intuitive.  I'd say give this game a shot if you've watched the trailer and think it looks interesting.

number of helpful: 1 of 4 people (25%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 8, 2016
Early Access Review
								OverGrowth is a game that has few major features, but those features are PERFECTED.Those main features are the combat and movement systems,  the movement is (IMO) the best part of the game.MOVEMENT;its smooth, it really feels responsive and well made. the main buttons are your movement keys, space and right click. as slimple as it looks the movement system takes time to master. the wallrunning into jumps and mastering rolls without breaking you characters spine (more on that later int the combat section) is quite a challange bet when pulled off feels great.COMBAT:The combat isnt your grandpa's comabt. its hard, fast and brutal based on a skeleton system and not on a normal health system. as mentioned earlier you can break bones limiting your blocking ability. on the topic of blocking, you cant just press a key and not be touched. its done in a way that you have to block on time or the block will fail.GRAPHICS:its grapics are Okay-ish. but its early access so that cant be judged.TL;DR: its great, if you like movement sytems and brutal combat pick it up on sale, its abit overpriced at the moment but toher than that i am hyped to see what Wolfire bring out next!

								This game has great potential, but is squandered by the lack of attention and constant updates that can possibly boost its sales. The mechanics are well thought out but the game needs more... game, for lack of a better word. It is riddled with bugs, constant crashes, and needs vital fixes to make the game better or at least functional long-term wise. Other than these things the combat is very pleasing and the movements feel very smooth. The "gameplay" is very addictive and weapons give the combatants a major advantage in battle just like in real life, so if a combatant has one you'll think twice about confronting them. I'd like to see mechanics implemented in the game that allow you to disarm opponents if you have the skills to do it. The races have unique skills and abilities to them that make them feel different from eachother but not uncomfortably so. Personally I think the Dog race is currently very strong because when confronted by an opponent, armed or otherwise, Dogs can perform what I like to call 0-Point Drop Kicks. Out of all the races, I have found that Dogs can perform this move the easiest. (Elaboration) 0-Point Drop Kick : When engaged with an opponent (hand-to-hand or armed), move one step forward to gain the minimun velocity required (for Dog) to initiate a light jump into drop kick. Succsessful "0-Points" result in the opponent recieving severe damage or in most cases, death. Keep in mind while performing this maneuver you have a high chance of self inflicted damage or suicide by broken neck if it misses of you land wrong.Things like made up techniques such as 0-Point Drop Kick and player creativity keep this game going, give it a try. Its looks aren't everything, but lack of content is.Q: Should you play this game?A: It can grow on you :)

number of helpful: 0 of 2 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 12, 2016
Early Access Review
								In the burgeoning days of Humble Bundle, Wolfire (who now manage the service) included in their bundle(s) "Lugaru": an indie title about a rabbit avenging his family against stylised, malevolent predators and turncoats. This is the successor to that 2005 title, in development for the better part of a decade (or more?). Anybody interested in Overgrowth should make sampling it their first visit.Overgrowth is, in my opinion, a worthy successor to Lugaru - but right now, it is a game in nigh-perpetual development: if you are looking for a finalized experience, this title should be avoided. Wolfire's YouTube channel maps the development cycle regularly, and there is clearly a lot of love being poured into this product by the developers - but the purchase, at this time, remains that of an interesting combat-sandbox title and the knowledge that you're supporting a (slow-growing) labour of love.

content:
Posted: August 19, 2016
Early Access Review
								Love it. Played the first one, Lugaru. Massive improvements to our armor clad hero, Turner, and of course those raiders with their assasin hoods.. Gameplay is very realistic, falling on your head can kill, enough of getting hit with a knife will kill, sword is a one hitter. If you use a knife, they won't bleed out, unfortunately.(Idea: Make the sword a two hit, so you can slice and then finish it with a nice stab to the heart! Also add a bleeding damage.) You will certainly be impressed. The blood is nice, reflecting off the sun light, giving it a more real appearance. (Maybe make a actual wound instead of just a red line?) The arena is brutal. Love it. A really nice detail is the breathing mechanic when they are unconscious or just a dead lump. (Hint: Watch their chest to see it in action.) Overall, I love this game. To those who say "THIS GAME SUX IT's TERRIBLE!"  I say to you: You have a bad computer, or you just don't understand what it takes to make a game.  Anyway, I hope anyone who reads this will be encouraged to buy this game.  ~Many thanks, TruFurry

content:
Posted: September 18, 2014
Early Access Review
								A buggy, unplayable mess, I got it for half the price it's at in the Steam store and I still feel totally ripped off, the game has no tutorial whatsoever, so far as I can tell the combat is just button mashing, as I understand from the other reviews it's never updated. The only single player mode that actually exists is gladiator, which like the rest of the game is appallingly bugged and poorly designed, if you're in the middle of a combo when you defeat your enemy you get insta-disqualified when the round immediately ends, which is especially weird when you're in a mode that is apparently 'fight to the death', so what exactly am I being DQed for, hitting a dead body? And sometimes your teammates just stand still and do nothing while the enemy beats them to death.The bigger problem is how often the game freezes, crashes, and so on, especially when changing between modes it performs terribly, since my PC can play pretty much every new game out on high graphics without an issue I can only assume Overgrowth is coded/optimised like♥♥♥♥♥♥The only good point is the graphics, which sorry, does not make a game on their own. Just seems like a cynical hustle of furries, looks nice for the promo pictures and trailer, get people to fork over the huge cost, horrible to play.

Posted: June 9, 2014
Early Access Review
								Overgrowth has the best combat system I have ever seen in any video game ever. The combat system is based on an acutal skeleton inside the rabbit. So like in real life, if you land on your neck wrong you could break your neck and die. This is the only game I have played where I can see an enemy, engage in a fist fight, and die half a second later (not even exagerating on the half a second part, you would understand if you have played it.) It is a really well built alpha game but at the same time it is an alpha so there is no real story mode or anything yet but there is an arena where you can fight AI. Buy this game you will not regret itTL;DRlike skyrim with bunnies 10/10

content:
Posted: January 2, 2015
Early Access Review
								Overgrowth is a great game. Many people are saying that it is not worth the price, and that it lags too much, and some of that is true (that half about it lagging.) Overgrowth is a very resource intensive game, but not all the time. The reason I waited a long time to buy it is I was worried about it lagging. I don't have that good of a computer, and I worried that I would spend $30 and it would be unplayable. Honestly, the parkour and just running around runs as fast as possible, the only time it lags is when there is fighting or ragdolls. that was just for those of you wondering. now, I know the price is a bit high, but it goes towards keeping the developer fed. as far as I know, there is only the one dev, and he is spending most of his time working on this, so this is his job. also, as far as development time, yes, it has been in development for years, but it is pretty much a game. sure, some textures are missing, and it crashes more than most games, but the core gaming experience is there. Also, there aren't many maps at first, but that is easily fixed. just set up your access to the secret forums (there is a great/ extensive guide on how to do that) and find the post about the SUM launcher. It is virus-free (I checked) and allows quick access to hundreds of community-made maps and new objects.Basically, with some setup, Overgrowth is a good game, well worth the money.

content:
Posted: November 27, 2015
Early Access Review
								Pros: +Has one of the most realistic fighting systems ever created+Map editor/Community mods/Maps +Weapons+More humanoid animals +More types of rabbits (Guards, Raiders, etc.) +Great graphics and shaders+SPEAR THROWING Cons: -Map editor is highly complicated and hard to use, well for me -Frequent crashes -Lots of bugs -Stealth isn't as good as it is in Lugaru -Default maps are boring and have nothing to do in them except spawn in enemies and kill them -Wolves are EXTEREMLY overpowered. We're talking about unblockable one-hit kills -Arena enemies get massively powerful and become giants if you spam the spark-laser Overall, I give this game a solid 9.8/10. 4Hope this helped. Man, I never knew it was so fun to write reviews-

content:
Posted: October 25, 2014
Early Access Review
								Some fun for two, maybe three hours. Very repetitive gameplay, almost no variety. The developing team is among the worst that I've dealt with. Since purhasing the game around 6 months ago, I have not seen one change in the gameplay, or more importantly, in what you can play. The only playable parts of the game are several challenges that can each be accomplished within minutes, and a game mode where you have to try to win over fans by fighting opponents. Also the $30 price tag for this atrocious, un-finished, and downright lazy game is absolutely ludicrous. I've purchased games for five dollars that I've gotten more out of than this filith.Stay the hell away from this game. Unless somehow, miraculously, the developers actually put some work in, and make it actually worth more than two dollars, this game is absolute crap and you should not purchase it.

number of helpful: 4 of 12 people (33%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 17
Early Access Review
								People will often say that this is one of those games that is in the so-called "eternal early-access."While it may seem like it at first, this game is actually in development, even if it is a very slow process.I would just tell you to ignore any of the posts saying that the game is done being developed, it is very much still at it.The game has a very in-depth combat system that is really one of those "easy to pick up, hard to master" things, where the player's combat moves are determined by their movement. While it may be very easy to just jump-kick your enemies to death, you'll find it much more entertaining to actually vary up your attacks, using throws, grabs, and well-timed roundhouse kicks.Right now, the game doesn't really have much of a point to it, but you can run around the basic maps and play around in the arena and practice your skills.I don't think it's worth all the money currently being charged for it, but it is a very fun game regardless.

number of helpful: 1 of 6 people (17%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 13, 2015
Early Access Review
								Best graphics i've seen in a while, Clean and smooth gameplay. Like mirrors edge but 3rd person and your a rabbit...Yup, your a rabbit doing parkour while fighting. A game like this doesn't need a good story line but it could utilize steam workshop to share levels much more easily. I have plenty of levels downloaded from the overgrowth forums but for the average person it may be a bit difficult navigating the maps and how to install them. The parkour is awesome and the combat is even better, you can use your stealth skills to the test or run out to your enemy with a machete. Maps and challenges that are given at the start of the game are straight up doo doo. The custom maps are the best aspect of the game. Even the mods, different playermodels, map customization and mods that affect the gameplay all help to make this game improve. I personally really enjoy this game and love the fact that the developers  DON'T listen to feedback and  DON'T have constant updates, *Cough* DayZ *Cough*

content:
Posted: November 27, 2015
Early Access Review
Overgrowth is a third-person action-adventure game, and acts as a successor to the game Lugaru, developed by Wolfire Games. It continues the story of an anthropomorphic rabbit, named Turner, who seeks to live with a new purpose, after suffering through many events of loss and betrayal. As of 2008, the game is still in development, with frequent updates made to it.GameplayOvergrowth is similar to its predecessor in terms of the mechanics of it, with some major tweaks made to it, like detailed environments, improvements made to the context-sensitive combat system, smoother and more fluid animations, and so on. The player can make use of different weapons to neutralize his or her opponents, such as knives, broadswords, and spears. The game is still in Alpha phase, so one can only play the game in its Sandbox-like mode, free to use different character models, and try out different things like arena fighting, or environmental exploration. VisualsThe improved visuals are a huge stepping stone to making the game much more enticing to its users. Comparatively, Overgrowth produces a much fresher take on the appearance of the characters and the environment to those who are familiar with Lugaru. For an independent developer, this game must be applauded for its overall artistic design.ControlsThe traditional use of K&M is encouraged here, as the response time is quicker and invigorating. The combat system also works remarkably well with them. A gamepad can also be used, but I would like to recommend the K&M instead. StoryThe game just  But, so far, what we know is that the game will take place in a pre-industrial era where the anthropomorphic community now exists without a leader, putting their world in a state of anarchy.ConclusionFor an independent developer like Wolfire Games, they have to be applauded for their hard work they have put into this game, in order to fulfill what a player really needs in a fighter game such as this. I used to own a Non-Steam version of it, and I've stacked up atleast 30+ Hours in it, because I found it extremely fun to mess around with it, as a way to pass time. But, I will admit that it's been too damn long since the game was in Early Access. It would be best if one gets it when it's on sale, but do get it if you're into fighter games.  UPDATE: The game has literally improved in the past months, there's real progress here. There's Arena Mode, Versus Mode, and a Sandbox Mode. You're also in for a surprise as the latest update adds a little something extremely special and nostalgic for us seasoned Lugaru players.UPDATE 2: The game is now released in Beta. They've added and modified so much, it's been brilliant. You are now treated with a slightly different version of the previous game, Lugaru, play loads of modes and arenas, and the game is much more stable. ALERT: I will say that the game is still on Early Access, which means the full version has not been released yet. So far, I have not encountered any bugs, except for framerate issues, and a few weird glitches. Buy the game only if you want to support the developers.

number of helpful: 0 of 4 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 11, 2015
Early Access Review
								This is one of my most anticipated games. I played Lugaru years ago & was addicted. Lugaru & Overgrowth have an insanely unique combat system, that is a blast & a half to play with. The parkour system is pretty good (a little troublesome for newcomers) great when you get used to the controls. You have the option of completing missions through stealth, all out brawl, bare handed or with weapons. There is an editor in both Lugaru & Overgrowth for the modders out there (Lugaru's is a little clunky, but with persistance & patients you can do some pretty good things). Even though I love both of these games so much. I'm going to say, "DON'T go into this thinking Overgrowth Is anywhere near finished". Overgrowth is basically just the in between a completed foundation & the start of some framework. There is very little content here(a few maps, a few obstacles to traverse & a couple enemies to toy with). Is it worth the pricetag? Absolutely not if you don't already love what this is going to be. Those of you that know Lugaru & see where David Rosen is going with this.... I say get on board, play with the new toys & give feedback to Wolfire. The community's support will only make this better. If you're sceptical, do yourself a favor & hunt down Lugaru. It's old & not pretty by today's standards, but it's damn good.******* I'm voting up not based on what it is now, but what I'm sure it will be. *******NOTE - The development is VERY slow moving. You were warned....... BUT IT'S GONNA BE EFFFFFFFFING AWWWWWSOME!!!

content:
Posted: December 20, 2013
Early Access Review
								It's 04/10/2016... Game is still cr4p. Not finished and still in EARLY ACCESS. Just NO.It's 20/12/2013 This is going to be a review of a game that is not yet finished. A lot of people are saying good stuff about it and I have to agree with them. However there is one thing they avoid to say or maybe they feel emotional attachment to the game therefore they won't say it. I on the other hand will say it because it was my +/- 20 pounds that was wasted here. This game has a big potencial but the biggest "flaw" its it biggest "strength"After watching some videos about the game I was really hyped about it. WOW! We need more games like this! Third person melee combat / action adventure ( perhaps later RPG dunno... its in alpha ). I was expecting to have awesome combat system you would expect from a fighting game ( like DOA 5 or SF or Tekken you name it... ) but it fails to fulfill my expectations. Combat is fluid yes but it feel unfair! Here's why :1. There is no tutorial at all ( maybe because it's alpha )2. You have only 2 BUTTONS?! One for attack and one for block ( so forget combos ) sure you have jump and crouch too...3. You have to be at the right distance from your enemy to perform CORRECT attack. If you are close you will either punch or kick with knee. If you are further away you will do roundhouse kick... etc. If for example you want to punch or do a swift kick YOU CAN'T!!! Because enemy won't stay in the same spot to let you come closer! SO IT FEELS CHEAP! I got so angry that the character wouldn't do what I wanted him to do because I was either not facing enemy properly or distance was too short or too long. So it comes down to timing and observing what your enemy will do while try to position yourself so you can counter.... This system doesn't work and causes massive frustrations.... SURE it's fast and can be satysfying if your character will perform well ( or actually do what you intended to do ).AT LEAST put a lock-on system for newbie players so I can always FACE the enemy and focus on either attacks or defending! ( Just like in Dark Souls ). Seriously there is no way to control whether you going to punch or kick... it happens automatically by judging distance. Other than that I have no problems with this game. Graphics are good for alpha and animations look ok ( but i would slightly slow them down ).... This game has a potential to become some special ( it would be nice to see really good campaign and possibly co-op whether split screen or online ). Tons of mods will save this game for sure. As for now I wouldn't advise ANYONE to dish out around 20 quid for this game! It's unfinished unpolished ( combat ) and there's not much to do. Save your money for triple A titles which are on sale! 20 quid for indie alpha game?! Seriously?.... So yeah I feel dissapointed... I hope it will turn out good in the end though. I can't recommend it just yet.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: June 22, 2014
Early Access Review
								While the game is still in early access (at time of writing) much of the basic game mechanics are in place, and they work very well: the platforming-parkour makes scaling the environments fun and filled with energy, the combat is fast and incredibly satisfying (even when the computer manages to take you out with a single blow, it will be from a brutal, spine-breaking blow that will leave you cringing and not feeling cheated), and the characters are animated well.Currently, the game is just a collection of maps and scenarios, but you can also download user-created content or create your own with an in-game editor.  As for an actual story mode - not yet.  Also, while there is some same-system multiplayer support in the form of a single-stage versus map, online multiplayer is not supported (hopefully "yet").I have nothing but praise for what this game is doing, but here are the only warnings I have for prospective buyers:1) You might be able to toggle it off (I personally don't, so I can't confirm it), the blood in the game might be disturbing to some.  Many a person who saw the Watership Down animated movie might have flashbacks.2) The game is labelled as "Furry" and you do play as animal characters, although the game does not (at writing) take the game down the shameful paths that are associated with that infamous genre.3) The content is somewhat light without an actual story mode.  If you get tired of running around in the environments and fighting in the arena mode, then you will have to wait for another update before you might think of returning to the game (an issue fairly common with these early access games).In ConclusionIf you aren't turned away by the content of the game, you will love the quality put into this game.

content:
Posted: February 14, 2014
Early Access Review
								Stunning game, endless possibilities with map creation and character customization (even though most of the character customiztion is for aesthetic purposes only). Tons of great people in the community who are willing to make maps, weapons, skins, so you can never run out of levels to try. Setting up the SUMLauncher is a bit of a butt hole, but it's great once you get it working; frequent updates and very innovative physics based close combat. Sooper enjoyable mang, I recommend it.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: February 14, 2014
Early Access Review
								Great if you want an incredibly fast fighting game. My most favorite part is the precise skeletal structure instead of health; and the AI is amazing ex. fleeing from combat to get reinforcements. It also has a level editor and smooth wallrunning and climbing. overall the game has a huge amount of potential and in my opinion could have an amazing story mode. Lastly, the game has a thing called SUM and it is basically the equivellent to the steam workshop. It does cost $29.99 but I am positive it is worth every cent.

content:
Posted: March 12, 2014
Early Access Review
								The best combat system I've ever experienced in a video game. It's fast paced and very reactive while also forcing you to adapt to your enemies as they always attack in different ways. It's a must own if you love hand-to-hand combat and even some sneaky parkour as well. Now, I just need to figure out how to use the small dev kit to produce my own maps, mods, weapons, characters, and even storyline.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: March 13, 2014
Early Access Review
								NOTICE: I like many others have played this game FAR more than steam saysnow the review,The game is a peice of art made by only 3 people (if I'm correct) that has a amazing combat system. it is still in early alpha so there is still problems with it.It also has a level editor that can be fun to mess with, i have built plaforms that are way up in the air so you have to break the other rabbits bones a lot or push them off the platform...If you want to play this game on good settings be sure to have a dedicated graphics card not a APU, If you have a APU you can still play but you will have to play at lower settings. Well except a few maps  that can be played on a APU but if you don't want to play on those few maps I would Highly recomend a dedicated graphics card, it doesn't even have to be a very good one like maybe a lower-mid end one from 2 years ago or laterThank you for reading my first review I actully put thought into ^-^

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: February 25, 2014
Early Access Review
								Overgrowth is the best Indie game I have ever played. The combat system is incredible, fast-paced, and most of all, fun. Since the characters don't have a set health; instead, each character has a skeletal system that measures how much damage you can take, allowing you to see how well the blood runs. This game is unlike any other fighting game I have ever played.It does have its downsides: the options menu has to be customized from the console... That's it... The only other bad thing about it is that not enough people have thrown money at this game so it could be completed.Overgrowth definitely recieves my recommendation! Buy this game!

content:
Posted: December 30, 2013
Early Access Review
								This game has huge potential to become the next big thing. It has a truely unique and fantastic damage system that can't be matched by even the big-budget games. Not only is it an extremely satisfying fighting game, it is a competent platformer. If you are 'umming and ahh-ing' whether to buy this game and considering whether it is worth the price, I can assure you, it absolutely is.
